data.text:
In many countries, less than 1% of the population has received COVID-19 vaccines. 

Join us at 11 AM ET for a joint press conference by @KGeorgieva, @DrTedros, @NOIweala & @DavidMalpassWBG on scaling up equitable access to COVID-19 vaccines. #VaccineEquity https://t.co/wUWQgMAyFL

In a new op-ed, the heads of the IMF, @WHO, @WTO, and @WorldBank call for a new commitment with a $50 billion investment to ensure vaccine equity and end the pandemic everywhere. https://t.co/tjEZw30OxD #VaccineEquity https://t.co/A6NGdWYkd4

During the pandemic, women with younger children have suffered larger job losses and/or a drop in hours than other women and men. 
Find out why ▶️ https://t.co/KgUdG13Mns #IMFBlog https://t.co/zra6V1ZkqZ

.@KGeorgieva at the #P4GSummit: “#Korea’s pledge to achieve carbon neutrality by 2050 is an important step forward. It means progress towards the neutrality goal, while also charting a path to recovery from #COVID19.” https://t.co/BJiIFZkDD0 https://t.co/vVXexb425V
How can #NewZealand turn its economic recovery from the pandemic into sustained growth? Read our #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/rsPgOb901g https://t.co/8iikVdTAco

Speaking at the #P4GSummit, @KGeorgieva outlined 3 policies for an inclusive #greenrecovery
1️⃣Put a price on carbon
2️⃣Green investment to create jobs & growth
3️⃣Facilitate a just transition to a low carbon economy.
https://t.co/bMfoA6yed4 https://t.co/NwHrJBP02p
Can information technology save jobs? https://t.co/hZIn8VUO2A #AnalyticalCorner https://t.co/uHkigmlQiw

▶️  STARTING NOW ◀️
How can we strengthen #ClimateAction to #buildforwardbetter and greener in the #postCOVID world? @KGeorgieva shares her perspectives during the #P4GSummit’s Leaders’ Dialogue.  https://t.co/Bqz15gcgrZ https://t.co/0c4Ohe0fhQ

Mobile money has been a lifeline for the unbanked population of low- and middle-income countries. What risks and benefits should countries weigh when creating policy that favors both service providers and end-users? https://t.co/qwj5Go3HFW #fintech https://t.co/SOxNIc7cfL

#Africa’s policymakers face 3 immediate and competing challenges: first, to meet increased spending needs; second, to contain a pronounced increase in public debt; and finally, to mobilize more tax revenue. More on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/XDGHB17L68 https://t.co/2XKe5VENRe
Asking new questions and seeking new solutions for the changing times. Learn more about the IMF's Comprehensive Surveillance Review. https://t.co/LNBPbZSEqY https://t.co/KfQ91nK5nN

The effects of climate change are disastrous for all life on the planet. Implementing smart policies now can both boost the economy and save the planet from the worst environmental consequences. https://t.co/uGqdAbENzC https://t.co/NxkEhm1rWP

In an #IMFBlog, @KGeorgieva looks at how to ensure that powerful corporations do not benefit at the expense of customers, workers, and governments in the aftermath of the crisis. https://t.co/LLDd20TaTZ #MarketPower https://t.co/sQjzPgtFru
Each year, the IMF assesses the financial sectors of certain economies. Who’s in the financial spotlight in 2021? Read the latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/t6md7TfHFy https://t.co/IraiT0gCcN

It’s time for #ClimateAction. Join us together w/ @BIS_org @banquedefrance and @NGFS_ as global leaders share their insights into the role of the financial sector 
 
Opening panel w/ @KGeorgieva: 6:15 AM ET 
 
Special guest speech by DMD Zhang: 12 PM ET 

https://t.co/cBCfSSzOqU https://t.co/ASIheUR76c

Sub-Saharan Africa’s policymakers face 3 immediate and competing challenges: first, to meet increased spending needs; second, to contain a pronounced increase in public debt; and finally, to mobilize more tax revenue. More on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/XDGHB17L68 #IMFAfrica https://t.co/RNKjE9ERPu

In many countries, #COVID19 vaccines have been given to less than 1% of the population. On #IMFBlog, @KGeorgieva, @GitaGopinath and @_RuchirAgarwal propose a $50 billion plan for bringing the health crisis under control. https://t.co/B9Vq4ILOXI #PandemicPlan https://t.co/iOJPCK3wL6

Pandemic policy is economic policy. 

IMF's @GitaGopinath and @_RuchirAgarwal explain the $50 billion staff plan to end the pandemic. https://t.co/B9Vq4ILOXI #PandemicPlan https://t.co/Qau7wyXIxs

Financial regulation hasn’t caught up with risks posed by big tech firms, and it’s time for a policymaker rethink, write Juan Carlos Crisanto and Johannes Ehrentraud of the @BIS_org. Learn more: https://t.co/01za03aOzs #fintech https://t.co/Y9Uwyrd8PU

A year into the pandemic, more information is now available on the progress of country governance measures related to IMF emergency support. These include publication of pandemic-related procurement contracts, audit results, and more. https://t.co/QIr91nftxi #IMFBlog https://t.co/tEyoNHbJTe

The gap between women’s & men’s participation in the work force nearly doubled in #China, rising from 9 percentage points in the 1990s to almost 15 percentage points in 2020. What can China do to combat rising #genderinequality? Read our latest research: https://t.co/JJdVtvKFHO https://t.co/atRt2JQTEk

The pandemic disrupted Sri Lanka’s historic tea industry, as live tea auctions could no longer be held. Technology helped update a 125-year old tradition in a matter of days, saving a vital economic sector. https://t.co/lW8qGLDJm2 https://t.co/nnlw5m7y2u

Excited to join forces w/ @BIS_org, @banquedefrance and @NGFS_ for a virtual conference on how the financial sector can take action against #climatechange-related risks. https://t.co/m5Y3P7GlKC #GreenSwanConference https://t.co/ws5nol7rtA

Our online lives prove a valuable resource for lenders... Is it moral for them to use #data captured from social media to determine consumer creditworthiness? @imf_podcast talks to @nikitaggarwal @oxfordethicslab https://t.co/sEhd13ZDvl

To confront a fast-changing world the IMF’s policy advice is evolving, on substance and in the way the Fund engages with its member countries. Find out more: https://t.co/hxac3D0E55. #IMFBlog https://t.co/r5hF6LnmRE

Technology can help usher in a period of shared growth after the pandemic – if we shape it in a way that creates jobs and spurs inclusive growth.

Read our Spring 2021 issue of #FandD Magazine. https://t.co/bZ9qfAzQVI https://t.co/UngptPbags

2021 is a critical year for #climateaction. This Monday at 9AM ET, @KGeorgieva participates in the #P4GSummitLeaders’ Dialogue to discuss what efforts can be made by countries to pursue an inclusive #GreenRecovery from #COVID19. Watch the livestream: https://t.co/3ASQ5nY7Tl https://t.co/APUaGO7spe

Sub-Saharan Africa will be the world's slowest-growing region in 2021, with economic activity growing by 3.4% in 2021. Watch and read our analysis in the latest Regional Economic Outlook for Sub-Saharan Africa. https://t.co/cm2FeRTL9M #IMFAfrica https://t.co/8O7AG5kdv5

Speed is of the essence in responding to COVID-19, but there is no reason for transparency and accountability to get lost in the process. Find out how we support the fight against #corruption and help prevent the misuse of emergency COVID-19 funding. https://t.co/pa5FJfyCv9

Infrastructure projects like roads and bridges tend to be large, long-term, and complex—all fertile ground for #corruption. Read about how countries can cut the waste: https://t.co/ii8MdU0opm #IMFBlog https://t.co/8FkntM8fxE

.@KGeorgieva: At the heart of the $50 billion IMF staff proposal to end the pandemic is closing the gap between wealthy countries with access to the vaccine and countries that still struggle to provide vaccinations.

Financial regulation hasn’t caught up with risks posed by big tech firms, and it’s time for a policymaker rethink, write Juan Carlos Crisanto and Johannes Ehrentraud of the @BIS_org. Read their #FandD article here: https://t.co/01za03aOzs #fintech

Deputy Managing Director Antoinette M. Sayeh: Economic divergence can also weigh down long-term growth in advanced economies. We must act now. Here are three areas where we need multilateral solutions. 

Read her speech at #ChamberGlobalForum:  https://t.co/9Vgq4CUrKe @USChamber https://t.co/CfuDib8Sww

https://t.co/iQYUJz6fP6

Women suffered large job losses during the pandemic and are coming back to work at a much slower pace than any other group. @cafreeland and @KGeorgieva on what to do about it... in this @imf_podcast https://t.co/9etV2mMDD2

Vaccinating at least 40% of the population in all countries by the end of 2021 and at least 60% by the first half of 2022 is essential to end the pandemic. Our latest staff research presents a proposal to achieve this goal. #PandemicPlan https://t.co/kC5gJhVnMi https://t.co/ORNSvNcIiH

Africa’s policymakers face 3 immediate and competing challenges: 
1. To meet increased spending needs
